Bryan.Boonville, Texas:
Boonville was the first county seat of Brazos County, Texas, now a ghost town.


== History ==
Boonville was the county seat in Brazos County (formerly known as Navasota County) in from the 1840s to the 1860s. Boonville was named in honor of Mordecai Boon, Sr., nephew of Daniel Boone.
